definitions: Caused extreme pain, anguish, or distress to.
Placed or stored on a rack.
Strained or stretched to an extreme degree.
Hit (a ball) with a cue stick in billiards or pool.
Arranged (balls) in a rack for billiards or pool.
examples: He racked the weights after his set.
Her mind was racked with guilt.
He racked the balls for the next game.
